title: DateTime (Struct)
text:
TYPE DateTime : STRUCT
Two formats are supported:
Absolute format: defines an exact time. âuiYearâ, âuiMonthâ, âuiDayâ, âuiHourâ, âuiMinuteâ and âuiSecondâ define the exact time. âuiWeekdayâ is of no importance.
Day of the month format: is selected by setting âuiYearâ to 0. âuiWeekdayâ defines a weekday and âuiDayâ specifies the day of the month in a value range of 1..5.
This notation makes it possible to define the first Sunday in April as well as the last Thursday in October
(âuiDayâ = 1 corresponds to the first weekday in a month, âuiDayâ = 5 corresponds to the last weekday in a month)
Note
The following applies for the summer time in Europe:
The switch to summer time is done on the last Sunday in March. At 2:00 a.m. the clock is set ahead by one hour.
The following applies for the winter time (standard time) in Europe:
The switch to winter time is done on the last Sunday in October. At 3:00 a.m. the clock is set back by one hour.

If Year = 0, then 1..5 1 => first day in this month, 5 =>
last day in this month
